newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - MARCH 7.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - MARCH 7.

text.p: These are the main headlines on Hungary's Kossuth Radio midday news. Reuters cannot vouch for their accuracy:

- The association of agricultural cooperatives (MOSZ) said the current demonstrations of farmers jeopardize the economy's stability, and the government was also responsible for that as it gave concessions to the farmers.
- Agricultural minister Frigyes Nagy confirmed that the government began discussions about the draft national agricultural programme.

- Foreign minister Laszlo Kovacs said only the NATO could create stability in central Europe. Defence minister Gyorgy Keleti said the NATO membership of the neighbouring countries is Hungary's essential interest.
- Forged 5,000 and 1,000 forint banknotes have appeared at several places in the country.
- Building societies are likely to conclude their first loan contracts within one month as the government have approved a decree on building societies.
- The jobless rate in Szabolcs-Szatmar-Bereg, the county in which the unemployed are in the worst situation, rose to above 20 percent, compared the 11.1 percent national average.
